block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' featuring NEO, with Mary Beck, flutist, and James Thoma, marimba. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. in the Henry Sawyer Room. Tickets: $7, or free with dinner. ''La Dolce Vita'' cabaret of movie songs of the 1960's, featuring Jilline Ringle. Through Aug. 20. Performances are at 9 p.m. on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday evenings. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $8 for children under 12. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
CRESCENT SCHOOL The Waldwick Band concert, featuring Paul Wallace, clarinetist, and Dennis Jones, tenor. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. The Crescent School, Crescent Avenue, Waldwick. (201) 664-2939.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' featuring NEO, with Mary Beck, flutist, and James Thoma, marimba. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. in the Henry Sawyer Room. Tickets: $7, or free with dinner. ''La Dolce Vita'' cabaret of movie songs of the 1960's, featuring Jilline Ringle. Through Aug. 20. Performances are at 9 p.m. on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday evenings. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $8 for children under 12. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
CRESCENT SCHOOL The Waldwick Band concert, featuring Paul Wallace, clarinetist, and Dennis Jones, tenor. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. The Crescent School, Crescent Avenue, Waldwick. (201) 664-2939.

FAIR LAWN SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL Symphony Orchestra, Marvin Von Deck, conductor, featuring Anne Marie Church, soprano. Today at 8:30 p.m. Harold Lieberman leads the Big Band in a tribute to the Swing Era Bands. Next Sunday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Memorial Park, Berdan Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201) 796-6746.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS 2000 Summer Season concludes with ''They Might Be Giants'' and ''NRBQ.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $28 and $25. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES ''Jazz on a Summer Afternoon,'' featuring Frank Ponzio, jazz pianist. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for members and old people. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, ext. 596.
KASSCHAU MEMORIAL SHELL Brasil and Co., jazz band. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Rio Clemente, jazz pianist. Thursday at 8:30 p.m. Free.Veterans Field, North Maple Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 444-1776.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings, 5 to 10 o'clock, through Aug. 31. Paloma, Bolero and Danza with jazz; The Paul Shapiro Quartet, Latin jazz; the Music of HipBone, soulful dance music. Free. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Through Sept. 9. Great Auditorium Organ Recital featuring Gordon Tuck, organist; Mertine Johns, mezzo-soprano; Holly Horn, violinist. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Gordon Tuck, organist and soloist. Saturday at noon. Free. Sandi Patty and Dino. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 (reserved); $20 (general admission). The Great Auditorium, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.
PRINCETON UNIVERSITY CHAPEL Melissa C. Moyer. Today at 1 p.m. Free. William Street and Washington Road, Princeton. (609) 258-3654.
ROWAN UNIVERSITY Ying String Quartet. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10, $13 and $16. Pfleeger Concert Hall, Wilson Hall, Glassboro Center for the Arts, Route 322, Glassboro. (856) 256-4545.
SHANGHAI JAZZ Wooster Street Trolley Dixieland Band. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Greg Cohen Trio. Thursday at 7 p.m. No cover. 24 Main Street, Madison. (973) 822-2899.
SIX FLAGS GREAT ADVENTURE Joyfest featuring Bryan White, country music. Today at 7 p.m. Free with park admission. Northern Star Arena, exit 7A off the New Jersey Turnpike. (732) 928-2000.

SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION Bill Kirchen and Too Much Fun (country blues and bluegrass). Tonight at 7 p.m. Free. Duke Island Park bandshell, across from Visitor's Center. (908) 722-1200, ext. 351.

SOMERSET COUNTY VOCATIONAL AND TECHNICAL SCHOOL ''Paris Washboard'' jazz quartet from France, as part of the Jazz in Bridgewater Series. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15. Intersection of Routes 22 and 202/206 and Interstate 287, Bridgewater. (908) 526-8900, ext. 7219.

STONE PONY ''Remembering Harry Chapin,'' a live concert tribute. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $20 and $30; proceeds benefit World Hunger Year, the Harry Chapin Foundation and the Food Bank of Monmouth/Ocean Counties. 913 Ocean Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 577-6589.

UNITARIAN UNIVERSALIST MEETING HOUSE ''Summer Sings 2000,'' featuring the Shrewsbury Chorale, Jonathan Dimmock, guest conductor. Tuesday and Aug. 15, 7:45 p.m. to 10 p.m. Tickets: $5. 1475 West Front Street, Lincroft. (732) 946-7204.
THEATER

BAYONNE JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER ''Grease,'' presented by the Young People's Summer Playhouse. Sneak preview on Tuesday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m.; next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10; $15 for patrons (first few rows). 1050 Kennedy Boulevard, Bayonne. (201) 436-6900.

EATONTOWN PLAYHOUSE ''Three Murders and It's Only Monday,'' murder mystery comedy spoof. Through Aug. 27. Fridays at 8:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $17 for Fridays and Saturdays; $16 for Sundays; $15 for students and older people on Fridays and Saturdays; $10 for students and older People on Sundays. 37 Highway 35 North, Tower Shopping Center, Eatontown. (732) 460-0100.

HUNTERDON HILLS PLAYHOUSE ''Razzmatazz,'' musical celebrating popular songs of the 20th century. Through Sept. 9 Monday through Saturday luncheon matinees beginning at 11 a.m.; Saturdays at 6:30 p.m.; Sundays at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $39.50 to $51 (includes show and lunch/dinner). ''Branson 2000,'' country variety show featuring Tim Gillis and his Band and Kassie DePaiva. Today at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $45 (dinner and show). Exit 12 off Routes 78 and 22, Perryville. (800) 447-7313.

LUMIA THEATER ''The Girl With the High Rouge,'' Vincent Sessa's surreal comic-drama, performed by the New Jersey Repertory Company. Through Aug. 20. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25; $35 for July 28, including reception. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.
LUMIA THEATER -- STAGE II ''African Nights'' staged reading. Tomorrow at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $7.50. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''Rhinoceros.'' Tuesday through Aug. 27. Performances are Tuesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; selected Saturdays and Sundays at 2 p.m. and selected Sundays at 7 p.m. Tickets: $21 to $38. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.
PARSIPPANY PLAYHOUSE ''Tony 'n' Tina's Wedding,'' presented by Allegro Productions. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 (dinner and show). 1130 Knoll Road, Parsippany. (973) 263-7020.

PLAYS IN THE PARK ''The King and I.'' Through Saturday. Performances every night at 8:30 p.m. except Sundays. Tickets: $3; free for children 12 and under. Stephen J. Capestro Theater, Roosevelt Park, off of Route 1 South, Edison. (732) 548-2884.

PREMIER THEATER COMPANY ''Mame.'' Through Aug. 19. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sunday matinees at 2 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for older people; $15 for students; $12 for children, 12 and under. Algonquin Arts Theater, 169 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 223-7122.
RITZ THEATER ''Secrets Every Smart Traveller Should Know,'' Puttin on the Ritz Senior Camp production. Wednesday and Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $8. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (609) 858-5230.

THEATER UNDER THE STARS ''Guys and Dolls.'' Through next Sunday. Today, Friday, Saturday and next Sunday at 8 p.m. Free. Degnan Park, next to West Orange High School, Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange. (973) 325-0795.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

BARRON ARTS CENTER ''New Jersey Teen Arts'' art exhibit. Friday through Aug. 22. Opening reception: Friday, 7:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. 582 Rahway Avenue, Woodbridge. (732) 634-0413.

CAMDEN COUNTY CULTURAL AND HERITAGE COMMISSION ''Home Traditions,'' an exhibition of domestic artifacts crafted by New Jersey folk artists. Bobbie Diamond Adams exhibition of mixed media painting and prints. James Cicalese exhibition of photographs. Through Sept. 8. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 2 to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m. Hopkins House, 250 South Park Drive, Haddon Township. (609) 858-0040.

CERULEAN FINE ARTS GALLERY ''New Works,'' a summer membership show, with paintings in all media, sculpture and photography. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 4 to 9 p.m. Headquarters Plaza Mall, Speedwell Avenue (Route 202), Morristown. (973) 267-3730.

CLEOPATRA STEPS OUT GALLERY ''Hang 10,'' fine crafts, home accessories, paintings and photography by 10 contemporary artists. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Wednesdays by appointment. 721 Cookman Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 774-6306.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE ''Summer 2000 Exhibition.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609) 586-0616.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART Lyanne Malamed, paintings and drawings. Through Sept. 10. ''Four Points of View: Artists From Lambertville.'' Through Sept. 10. Opening reception: Today, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908) 735-8415.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES ''Exploring Collage,'' exhibition by Naomi Kahan, a Ridgewood artist. Through Aug. 29. Artist's reception: Today, 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m to 10 p.m.; Friday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

LAUREL TRACEY GALLERY Summer Sculpture Series featuring works by Don Bonham, Don Harger, Michael Malpass and Jon Peters. Through Aug. 19. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Sundays, 12:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. 10 White Street, Red Bank. (732) 224-0760.

LONG BEACH ISLAND FOUNDATION OF THE ARTS AND SCIENCES ''Sixth Annual Loveladies Arts Festival.'' Today, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Donation: $3. ''National Juried Competition.'' Through Wednesday. ''Foundation Faculty Exhibition.'' Through Sept. 6. ''2000 Craft Gallery.'' Through Oct. 15. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. 120 Long Beach Boulevard, Loveladies. (609) 494-1241, extension 300.

MONMOUTH MUSEUM ''New Jersey's Pinelands: Water in the Balance.'' Through Sept. 3. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $4. 761 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (732) 747-2266.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Croquet: The Art of Play.' Through Oct. 15. Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m.; Sept. 9 through Oct. 15, course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $4 for children. Will Barnet: A Timeless World. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''A Collector's Vision: Selections From the Collections of Edmund W. Pease and Nurak Israsena.'' Through Sept. 17. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.
NABISCO GALLERY ''Alchemy: Society of Layerists in Multi-Media.'' Through Sept. 6. Hours: daily, noon to 4 p.m. 100 DeForest Avenue, East Hanover. (973) 503-2000.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Building a Collection: Fine Art at the New Jersey State Museum.'' Through Aug. 20. ''Leah Phyfer Sloshberg Collection of Fine Art.'' Through Sept. 3. ''The Art of Jack Delano.'' Through Sept. 4. ''Of Rock and Fire.'' On extended view. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Wetlands.'' Through Sept. 17. ''2000 New Jersey Fine Arts Annual: Into the Millennium.'' Through Sept. 17. ''The Luminous Image, V,'' and exhibition of illuminated photography. Through Oct. 8. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART Inspired by Nature series, featuring ''Recreating Flowers: The Glass Wonders of Paul J. Stankard.'' Through Sept. 3. ''Capturing the Jersey Shore: Works of Anthony J. Rudisill.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

PATERSON MUSEUM ''Up on Two Wheels: A Look Back at Motorcycling in North Jersey,'' show includes antique, classic, military, police, American, Japanese and European models. Through Sept. 24. ''Pair of Progenitors: The Art of Don Kommit and Joe Ruffilo.'' Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. 2 Market Street, Paterson. (973) 881-3839.

SEA BRIGHT LIBRARY Karen Cohen and Linda Levy: Joint Art Show. Through August 30. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays, 3 p.m. to 9 p.m. Cultural Arts Center, 1097 Ocean Avenue, Sea Bright. (732) 229-5503.

TRENTON CITY MUSEUM ''TAWA (Trenton Artists Workshop Association) Two Thousand.'' Through Sept. 24. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. Ellarslie, Cadwalader Park, Trenton. (609) 989-3632.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER ''Studio One.'' Through Aug. 31. Opening reception: Next Sunday, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m.Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. 18 Sterling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. ''HER,'' multi-media exhibit. Through next Sunday. No admission charge to the Gallery of American Craft. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.
FOR CHILDREN
EATONTOWN PLAYHOUSE ''The Mother Goose Show.'' Saturday at 3 p.m. For ages 4 to 7. Tickets: $7.50. 37 Highway 35 North, Tower Shopping Center, Eatontown. (732) 460-0100.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Stuart Little.'' Through Aug. 19. Tuesdays and Thursdays at 10 a.m.; Wednesdays at 1 p.m.; Saturdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

MORRIS COUNTY PARK COMMISSION ''Scavenger Hunt.'' Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. Preschooler Walk. Wednesday at 2:30 p.m. Fee: $5 a child; pre-registration is required. ''Bats,'' slide show and discussion. Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center, 247 Southern Boulevard, Chatham Township. (973) 635-6629.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''Once Upon a Time,'' as part of the Saturn Summer Series for Children. Tuesday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. ''Red Hot 'n' Rollin.'' Thursday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. Ticket: $7.75; $6.50 for members. Children's Theater. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-8069.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Where in the Universe Is Carmen Sandiego?'' at the Alice and Leonard Dreyfuss Planetarium. Through October. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays at 2:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for members; $1 for children and older people. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6355.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART ''Nature and Watercolors'' Summer Art Workshop. Wednesday, 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. For children ages 6 to 12. Fee: $15; $10 for members. Pre-registration is required. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

PARSIPPANY PLAYHOUSE ''Heidi,'' the musical, presented by Allegro Productions. Tuesday through Aug. 22. Saturday performances at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. Tickets: $10. 1130 Knoll Road, Parsippany. (973) 263-7020.

STONY BROOK-MILLSTONE WATERSHED ''Under the Bridge,'' children's art and nature series. Tomorrow, Tuesday and Wednesday, 9:30 a.m. to noon. For children, ages 6 to 12. Fee: $55; $40 for members. ''Butterflies on Parade'' for preschool children. Tuesday and Thursday, 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. Fee: $8; $5 for members. Pre-registration is required. ''Guitar Virtuosity: Greg Merkle and Keith McPeters.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Fee: $7; $4 for children under 12. Stony Brook Coffeehouse. Buttinger Nature Center, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-7592.

WALT WHITMAN CULTURAL ARTS CENTER Fun Summer Fridays, through Aug. 25. Philareyto Experience, Puerto Rican dances. Friday, 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Free; donations accepted. Johnson Park at Second and Copper Streets, Camden. (856) 964-8300.
ETC.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Wednesday Night Comedy Film Festival.'' Through August. ''Cotton Comes to Harlem.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. ''Traveling Ark Poetry Showcase.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Seating is limited to 65 people. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215, ext. 244.
FLAT ROCK BROOK NATURE CENTER Perseids Meteor Showers. Friday, 8:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. Fee: $2. Pre-registration required. 443 Van Nostrand Avenue, Englewood. (201) 567-1265.
GARDEN STATE COIN, STAMP and CURRENCY SHOW Today, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Free. The P.A.L. Building (next to Smith Field off of Rt. 46), 33 Baldwin Road, Parsippany. (201) 335-0555.

HISTORIC COLD SPRING VILLAGE Saturday Evening Concert Series. Through Sept. 2. Doctors of Rhythm. Saturday at 6:30 p.m. Village Gazebo. Free. Antique Show and Sale. Saturday and next Sunday, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people; $3 for children, ages three to 12. 720 Route 9, three miles north of Cape May City. (609) 898-2300.

SOCLAIR MUSIC FESTIVAL Chatham Baroque will perform 17th- and 18th-century music on period instruments. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $18 (outdoor seating); $12 for students and older people. Refreshments served at 3 p.m. Barn at Soclair Brooks Farm, 19 Hayton Road, Lebanon. (908) 236-6476.

SUSSEX COUNTY FARM AND HORSE SHOW AND THE NEW JERSEY STATE FAIR Through next Sunday. Includes animal nursery, petting zoo, carnival rides and games, the Potbellied Pig Beauty Pageant (Saturday at 6:30 p.m.), and more. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m.; next Sunday until 7 p.m. Call for admission, directions and carnival specials. Sussex Country Fairgrounds, (973) 948-5500.
AT THE CASINOS
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800) 736-1420.
ATLANTIC CITY HILTON Ray Charles. Friday at 9 p.m.; Saturday at 10 p.m.; next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $40 and $45. Grand Theater, Boston and Pacific Avenues. (609) 340-7200.

BALLY'S PARK PLACE ''Legends in Concert,'' impersonations of Stevie Wonder, Little Richard, Elvis Presley, Linda Ronstadt and Barbara Streisand. Mondays through Thursdays at 3:30 and 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 and 10:30 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 and 10 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $25. Park Cabaret, Boardwalk and Park Place. (800) 225-5977.
CAESARS ATLANTIC CITY Bobby Vinton. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35. Circus Maximus Theater, 2100 Pacific Avenue. (800) 677-7469.

CLARIDGE HOTEL ''Pump Boys and Dinettes,'' national tour of the Broadway musical. Through Sept. 24. Performances are Mondays through Thursdays at 8 p.m.; Saturdays at 9 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15, Sundays through Thursdays; $19, Saturdays. Palace Theater, Boardwalk and Park Place. (609) 340-3700.

SANDS HOTEL AND CASINO Jerry Blavat. Thursday, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Bud Noble. Wednesday through Saturday, 6 p.m. to 10 p.m. Dr. Cheeko. Wednesday through Saturday, 10:15 p.m. to 2:15 a.m. Copa Lounge. Free. The Diamonds. Through Sept. 10. Call for times. Tickets: $15. Cozy Morley. Tuesdays and Wednesdays through Aug. 30, at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Indiana Avenue and Brighton Park. (609) 441-4137.

TROPICANA ''Friday Night Fights,'' Live Boxing on ESPN 2. Friday at 7:45 p.m. (doors open at 6:30 p.m.). Tickets: $75 (ringside); $35 (mezzanine); $20 (bleachers and balcony). Atlantic City by Night XXXII Vietnamese/American Variety Show. Saturday at 11:30 p.m. Tickets: $75 (orchestra); $55 (mezzanine); $40 (balcony). Latin Fever Revue. Through Sept. 21. Call for times. Tickets: $9.90. ''Titanic: The Return,'' all new exhibition with more than 250 artifacts. Through Sept. 9. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Tickets: $14.95; $6.95 for children, ages 5 to 11. Grand Exhibition Center, fourth floor, South Tower. Boardwalk and Brighton Avenue. (609) 340-4020.

TRUMP MARINA Fourplay. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $35. Psychedelic Furs. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $28. The Shell. George Thorogood and the Destroyers. Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $35. Grand Cayman. Huron Avenue and Brigantine Boulevard. (800) 777-8477.

TRUMP PLAZA ''Dancin' in the Streets,'' a song and dance block party. Mondays and Thursdays at 4 p.m.; Tuesdays through Thursdays at 7:30 p.m.; Fridays at 9 p.m. and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 31. Tickets: $18; $12 for matinees. Boardwalk at Mississippi Avenue. (800) 759-8786.
TRUMP TAJ MAHAL Michael McDonald. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $35. Pat Benatar. Saturday at 9 p.m.; next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $35. Xanadu. 1000 Boardwalk. (609) 449-1000.
ON THE TOWNS
